Description: Terracotta figure of standing woman. Fragment of head only. Her forehead is framed by an arch of semicircular curls. Her face is thin with prominent features. Mould-made and solid. Red-brown clay with grey core and rare mica (?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from Camirus, Rhodes (Higgins 1970, 204-213, particularly late 5th century BC example 284) and Attic forms in a different fabric (ibid. no.669). Possibly a local copy, but more likley an East Greek original made in Rhodes of a standing woman.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.341) (Phase 3)
